results.title: The Green hornet. Vol. 1
results.creator_credit: Ford Beebe, Ray Taylor and Universal Pictures
results.brief_description: Volume one contains chapters 1 to 6. Based on the successful radio serial of the same name, Britt Reid (Gordon Jones) as the Green Hornet and his crime fighting partner, Kato (Keye Luke) battle against organised crime’s king-pins. The Green Hornet is the direct descendant of the famous masked crime fighter, The Lone Ranger. He’s the Lone Ranger’s grand nephew. This movie serial used the same principal characters that featured in the radio play, as well as the famous Hornet musical signature (Flight of the Bumble Bee) and gadgetry such as a gas gun to incapacitate criminals. Also used is the voice of Al Hodge, the radio Green Hornet, which was heard when crusading publisher Britt Reid spoke from behind the Hornet mask. Also stars Anne Nagel as Lenore Case.

results.title: Broken China: the earthquake that never happened
results.creator_credit: Liu Chun, Qi Kejun, Xue Song, Chen Meng, Lin Xiezhong, Wei Bin, Yu Bo, Yuan Zhengming, Zhao Shujing, ABC-TV (Australia), CCTV and Southern Star Entertainment
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “The Dragon stirs”.
Part one of a four part series about China. On 28 July 1976 a natural disaster - the worst ever recorded in China - killed over a quarter million people in the industrial city of Tang Shang, just 100km east of Beijing. An earthquake of massive proportions ripped the city apart destroying 96% of its buildings and burying alive over 600,000 people, all within 53 seconds. Fearing political unrest with the imminent death of Chairman Mao, the Chinese Government kept the extent of the disaster a State secret rejecting international offers of help preferring instead to send in thousands of their own soldiers from the People’s Liberation Army. This documentary records the amazing effort by the soldiers and the people of Tang Shang to rebuild their city in the aftermath of the earthquake. Through personal interviews by survivors and their stories of heroic acts, miracles, and tragedies, the film provides an insight into the spirit, unity and courage of these people who 20 years on still carry the memories and emotional scars. It is a heart-warming story of humans co-operating together as one in the most adverse of circumstances. Contains b&w archival footage. Narrated by Peter George and Diana McLean. In Mandarin with English subtitles and commentary in English.
results.title_for_label: Broken China: the earthquake that never happened
results.creator_credit_for_label: Liu Chun, Qi Kejun, Xue Song, Chen Meng, Lin Xiezhong, Wei Bin, Yu Bo, Yuan Zhengming, Zhao Shujing, ABC-TV (Australia), CCTV and Southern Star Entertainment

results.title: The Great New Zealand Fishing Safari
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Action Downunder”.
Geoff Thomas and his guests travel throughout New Zealand in search of the best fishing. He and his guests journey to some of New Zealand’s most spectacular locations in search of striped marlin, rainbow trout, mako sharks, snapper and many more. One in a series of films which capture some of the world’s most exciting fishing action.

results.title: Revenge of the river gods
results.creator_credit: Liu Chun, Qi Kejun, Xue Song, Chen Meng, Lin Xiezhong, Wei Bin, Yu Bo, Yuan Zhengming, Zhao Shujing, ABC-TV (Australia), CCTV and Southern Star Entertainment
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “The Dragon stirs”.
Part two of a four-part series about China. The Yangtze River floods of the summer of 1998 destroyed 50 million homes and devastated 21 million hectares of farmland. It was China’s worst recorded flood in at least 50 years lasting for several weeks and affecting many villages and cities. Beijing reacted by immobilizing three-quarter million soldiers into the biggest force since liberation in 1949. This is not the first time the Yangtze (known by the Chinese as the “Mother of China”) has caused havoc through flooding. However this time it would appear that not only is the unusual weather conditions to blame, but destruction of the environment over time through damming, re-routing and mismanaging of the Yangtze, forest-clearing and filling-in of natural lakes in the Yangtze River Basin and greed, dishonesty and corruption by provincial and city officials responsible for building the dams have all contributed to this unprecedented natural disaster. The program features some amazing images of the floods and includes actual footage of many of the search and rescue efforts performed by the soldiers. It also demonstrates the remarkable fortitude and commitment by both civilians and soldiers in their mighty struggle to hold back the unrelenting waters. Contains b&w archival footage. Narrated by Peter George and Diana McLean. Commentary in English with occasional dialogue in Mandarin with English subtitles.

results.title: The Great primitives. - Vol. 1.
results.creator_credit: Auguste Lumiere, Louis Lumiere and Jason Films Productions
results.brief_description: A collection of excerpts from some early pioneer films made between 1895-1912. The films included are; “Lumiere Premiere Program”, made in 1895; “A Trip to the Moon”, made in 1902; “Great Train Robbery”, made in 1903; and, a series of animations done by Cohl between 1908-1912.

results.title: The Great step forward: China women in the 20th century. Parts 1 and 2
results.creator_credit: Liu Chun, Qi Kejun, Xue Song, Chen Meng, Lin Xiezhong, Wei Bin, Yu Bo, Yuan Zhengming, Zhao Shujing, ABC-TV (Australia), CCTV and Southern Star Entertainment
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “The Dragon stirs”.
Final two parts of a four-part series about China. China, known as the Middle Kingdom between heaven and hell, has a long history of patriarchy and an unquestioning obedience by women to their family and feudal overlords. However, with the coming of the new millennium a law was passed allowing China’s women the same social and political rights as men. This is a historical presentation of women and their role in China, politically, socially, and philosophically during the 20th century looking at the traditions, culture and customs which held China’s women back for so long in their fight for equality with their male counterparts. Issues covered include arranged marriages, the binding of women’s feet, outside influences, Chinese reformists and feminists, the women’s movement, Mao Tse Dong and the Peoples Liberation Army, communism, Cultural Revolution of the 60s, sexuality in the 70s, free market and consumerism in the 80s and 90s. Features personal stories from women of all ages and varying backgrounds, archival footage including b&w images, excerpts from motion pictures made in China and profiles of those who played an influential role in the advancement of women’s rights in China. Narrated by Peter George and Diana McLean. In Mandarin with English subtitles and commentary in English.

results.title: The Great mouse detective
results.creator_credit: Burny Mattinson, David Michener, John Musker, Ron Clements and Walt Disney Pictures
results.brief_description: Early computer animated Disney feature, features the mellifluous tones of Vincent Price as Professor Rattigan, a Sherlock Homes type character who is a master of mystery sleuthing. Set in Victoria London, England Rattigan (a highly intelligent scientific mouse) is joined by various cohorts on the trail of the abducted father of a little mouse. An entertaining effort directed at children, that charms in many ways with its gentle humour and fun characterisations.

results.title: The Great Karoo
results.creator_credit: Trevor de Kock, Colin Cradock, BBC and National Geographic Society
results.brief_description: The Great Karoo stretches for over a quarter of a million miles occupying most of the inner land mass of the Cape Province of South Africa. It was called “The Great Dry” by early human inhabitants and its harsh climate with extreme temperatures make it a hostile environment for its animals. From the Black Eagle, to the tiniest mouse, the animals survive. This is an opportunity to explore one of the most arid, but most beautiful environments in the world.
